title.narrative: IRP Support to Pakistan's Action to Counter Terrorism (PACT), with special reference to Khyber Pakhtunkhwa

description.narrative: This interim response programme will contribute to the fight against terrorism in Pakistan, and in particular in KP, through improved criminal justice processes. Support will be provided to security and law enforcement agencies to improve investigation, prosecution and adjudication of terrorism cases. Federal and interprovincial coordination on counter-terrorism related matters will be reinforced. Greater judicial integrity and compliance with human rights will be promoted

title.narrative: International Urban Co-operation : Sustainable and Innovative Cities and Regions Regional action Latin America

description.narrative: The project will establish cooperation on a mutual benefit basis with sub-national authorities in the LAC region in three fields: sustainable urban development; climate change through sustainable energy; and regional innovation systems. It will draw upon cooperation models and policy experience gained from EU urban programmes and the Covenant of Mayors. The stakeholders include national and sub-national authorities, their groupings and associations, as well as businesses.

title.narrative: Cooperation with major economies for the implementation of the Paris Agreement

description.narrative: This action is designed to support the EU's international climate leadership through providing solid EU inputs to the efforts of key partner countries to implement their commitments to the Paris Agreement. It targets non-EU G20 members, with the exception of Turkey and with the addition of Iran. The action focusses on four priority areas: mitigation policy instruments, mid-century strategies - renewal/updating of Nationally-Determined Contributions (NDCs), transparency and adaptation planning.

title.narrative: Support to the consolidation of state building in Somalia

description.narrative: The measure has three components. The first component will support stabilisation and state-building at local level by strengthening the Somalian authorities' accountability and responsiveness to the needs of its population. The second component will facilitate regular consultations between Somali political leaders. The third component (EUR 1.3 million) will support the implementation of the peace agreement between the Federal Government of Somalia,Galmudug and the Ahlu Sunna Wal Jamaa.
